page.title: 19MULLION COMPREHENSIVE SCHOOL
page.content: Mullion Comprehensive School was built in 1978 to relieve the great number of pupils going to Helston. At present, 550 pupils between the ages of 11 and 16 attend. There are 30 teachers and a headmaster. If, at the age of 16, a pupil wishes to continue his academic education, he has to go to Helston School Sixth Form. In the first three years at Mullion pupils study English, Maths,Humanities (History,Geography and Religious Education),Science (Physics, Chemistry and Biology), Music,Design (Art,Metalwork,Woodwork, Needlework,Home Economics), Languages (Spanish,French) and Physical Education. At the end of the 3rd year pupils choose the subjects they take. They must take English, Maths and P.E. and select two subjects from each of: Science,Humanities,Design/Languages. They take O-levels or CSEs in these.
